member.name: T:JetBrains.VsIntegration.DevTen.Install.MsiExtensionManifestInstaller

member.summary: Gets the path to the folder into which the LNK files to R# VSIX Manifest and PkgDef are installed in per-machine installation scenario. The path is relative to the VS installdir, which is what's written into Registry by VS, and it points to the "IDE" folder not the very VS installation root.

member.name: F:JetBrains.VsIntegration.DevTen.Install.PackageDefWriter.PkgDefMacros.AppDataLocalFolder
member.summary: Path to the sub-folder of CSIDL_LOCAL_APPDATA used by this application – based on the user settings root (e.g. “C:\Users\{user}\AppData\Local\VisualStudio\10.0”).

member.name: F:JetBrains.VsIntegration.DevTen.Install.PackageDefWriter.PkgDefMacros.AppName
member.summary: Name of the Boutique application (not defined for other appids).

member.name: F:JetBrains.VsIntegration.DevTen.Install.PackageDefWriter.PkgDefMacros.BaseInstallDir
member.summary: Synonym for ShellFolder for backward compatibility.

member.name: F:JetBrains.VsIntegration.DevTen.Install.PackageDefWriter.PkgDefMacros.CommonFiles
member.summary: Path to the common files folder for the application (i.e., value of CSICL_PROGRAM_FILES_COMMON) (e.g., “C:\ProgramData\VisualStudio\10.0”)

member.name: F:JetBrains.VsIntegration.DevTen.Install.PackageDefWriter.PkgDefMacros.HivelessRootKey
member.summary: Same as RootKey, without the HKEY_CURRENT_USER portion.

member.name: F:JetBrains.VsIntegration.DevTen.Install.PackageDefWriter.PkgDefMacros.MyDocuments
member.summary: Path to the user’s Documents folder (e.g., “C:\Users\{user}\Documents”).

member.name: F:JetBrains.VsIntegration.DevTen.Install.PackageDefWriter.PkgDefMacros.PackageFolder
member.summary: Folder in which the PkgDef file was found.

member.name: F:JetBrains.VsIntegration.DevTen.Install.PackageDefWriter.PkgDefMacros.ProgramFiles
member.summary: Parent folder for all program installations (e.g., “C:\Program Files”)

member.name: F:JetBrains.VsIntegration.DevTen.Install.PackageDefWriter.PkgDefMacros.RootFolder
member.summary: Path to the root of the application installation; for Visual Studio and the Express SKUs, this is the same as ShellFolder; for Boutique applications (Isolated shell) this is a different folder, specific to the application. In the latter case, the value is read from HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\{registry root}\RootFolder.

member.name: F:JetBrains.VsIntegration.DevTen.Install.PackageDefWriter.PkgDefMacros.RootKey
member.summary: Parent key for all Configuration values (e.g. “HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\VisualStudio\10.0_Config”).

member.name: F:JetBrains.VsIntegration.DevTen.Install.PackageDefWriter.PkgDefMacros.ShellFolder
member.summary: Path to the root of the Visual Studio shell installation; read from HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\{registry root}\InstallDir; for Portable SKUs, this is computed by removing the last two levels of the path to the executable or by applying the rule specified by RelativeRootFolderPath.

member.summary: Windows\System32 directory.

Writer for the XML output.

Whether we're generating a manifest for the product installed MSI-way, where the manifest is needed for enabling MEF only. False means we're writing the standalone VSIX file.

member.name: M:JetBrains.VsIntegration.DevTen.Interop.Extension.IWpfTextViewEx.GetWindowFrameDevTen(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.Editor.IWpfTextView)
member.summary: Gets the new window frame object. However, most methods follow the COM convention and cannot be used directly. Instead, you should use the shim returned from for better API and error control.

summary.para: Gets our object attached to the given Visual Studio text control.

Note that the object from our model corresponding to the Visual Studio model object is not guaranteed to exist at the moment of your call (eg you're calling from MEF and our Shell is not running yet/already). In this case the returned non-Null property has a Null value, and you should listen to the changes to its value (eg with ).

This technique allows to combine lifetimes of MEF and Shell entities: whether you look into this property before jet model object is created or when it's already available, your handler will be called when jet model object is ready.

member.name: M:JetBrains.VsIntegration.DevTen.Interop.Shim.ConversionDevTen.MapUpToTop2(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.Projection.IBufferGraph,Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.SnapshotPoint,Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.PointTrackingMode,Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.PositionAffinity)
member.summary: Maps the point to the topmost buffer of the graph. Emulates ::MapUpToTop function that were present in Beta1 but was gone in between August and September CTPs.
member.param: Buffer graph.
A point in some buffer in the .
How is tracked to the current snapshot if necessary.

If the mapping is ambiguous (the position is on a source span seam), determines whether the mapping should target the position immediately after the preceding character or immediately before the following character in the top buffer. This setting has no effect if the mapping is unambiguous.
The corresponding position in a snapshot of the top buffer, or null if the position does not map to the top buffer using this graph.

member.name: T:JetBrains.VsIntegration.DevTen.Local.JumpVsixFromMachineToPerUser
member.summary: In Internal mode, suggests turning a per-machine install into a per-user one. This is needed to have more than one hive: starting with DevTen, per-machine components can only be registered for ALL hives at once. This code takes the product shortcuts installed into Common7\IDE\Extensions and relocates them to %LOCALAPPDATA%\Microsoft\VisualStudio\10.0\Extensions.

member.name: M:JetBrains.VsIntegration.DevTen.Local.JumpVsixFromMachineToPerUser.AskCleanupInstallationsByOtherVersions

member.name: M:JetBrains.VsIntegration.DevTen.Local.JumpVsixFromMachineToPerUser.AskJump
member.summary: Asks whether to jump. Returns whether a jump was needed (if dialog will be shown, returns before actually doing the jump, and the jump could then be canceled by the user).

member.name: M:JetBrains.VsIntegration.DevTen.Local.JumpVsixFromMachineToPerUser.CleanupAllPerHiveExtensionsInThisHive
member.summary: Before doing a jump, delete all possible per-hive extensions in this hive. More aggressive than .

member.summary: Called by when it's decided (by logics or user) not to jump.

member.name: T:JetBrains.VsIntegration.DevTen.Application.MethTest.IMethTestServer
member.summary: Detects broken installations. Now R# in DevTen consists of two separate things: VS Package and VS MEF extension. The first is the main one, but the second is required for normal operation. It's possible that one of them would fail. We consider the VS Package failure to load to be uncommon and fatal, whilst MEF would have its quirks from time to time. These situations we would like to explicitly detect and report, otherwise the symptoms could be ambiguous. This is the "server" part: an interface to the component registered with MEF, its presence to be checked by the package when it gets running.

member.name: T:JetBrains.VsIntegration.DevTen.Application.MethTest.MethTestServer
member.summary: Detects broken installations. Now R# in DevTen consists of two separate things: VS Package and VS MEF extension. The first is the main one, but the second is required for normal operation. It's possible that one of them would fail. We consider the VS Package failure to load to be uncommon and fatal, whilst MEF would have its quirks from time to time. These situations we would like to explicitly detect and report, otherwise the symptoms could be ambiguous. This is the "server" part: a component registered with MEF, its presence to be checked by the package when it gets running.

member.name: T:JetBrains.VsIntegration.DevTen.Application.MethTest.MethTestClient
member.summary: Detects broken installations. Now R# in DevTen consists of two separate things: VS Package and VS MEF extension. The first is the main one, but the second is required for normal operation. It's possible that one of them would fail. We consider the VS Package failure to load to be uncommon and fatal, whilst MEF would have its quirks from time to time. These situations we would like to explicitly detect and report, otherwise the symptoms could be ambiguous. This is the "client" part: a VS Package component to check the presence of MEF-registered components some time after startup.

member.name: M:JetBrains.VsIntegration.DevTen.TextControl.VsTextControlCoordinateConversionDevTen.TextControlLineColumn_To_Viewport(JetBrains.TextControl.TextControlLineColumn)
member.summary: This is the central char-to-pixel conversion method in the DevTen case. It has no such immanent thing as canvas coordinate system, only viewport-relative coords are defined with acceptable accuracy. The scrolling is probably in lines, and canvas coord depends on the line height of the lines above the view, which is not calculated until they get into the viewport.

member.name: M:JetBrains.VsIntegration.DevTen.TextControl.VsTextControlCoordinateConversionDevTen.Viewport_To_TextControlLineColumn(System.Windows.Point)
member.summary: This is the central pixel-to-char conversion method in the DevTen case. It has no such immanent thing as canvas coordinate system, only viewport-relative coords are defined with acceptable accuracy. The scrolling is probably in lines, and canvas coord depends on the line height of the lines above the view, which is not calculated until they get into the viewport.

member.name: M:JetBrains.VsIntegration.DevTen.TextControl.VsTextControlCoordinateConversionDevTen.GetAverageLineHeight(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.Editor.IWpfTextView)
member.summary: Lines outside the viewport do not have layout, pixel coordinates, or height values. To approximate pixel y-coordinates outside the viewport, we use the average viewport line height.

member.summary: Gets the command target for the current VS text view.

member.name: M:JetBrains.VsIntegration.DevTen.TextControl.VsTextControlDevTen.IsPositionInTextView(JetBrains.TextControl.Coords.ITextControlPos)
member.summary: Gets whether the given document position is present in the text view of the text control.
member.param: The document position in the unified position format (. or .).
member.remarks: Even though every position could be converted to a text view (and usually a reasonable value will be returned), sometimes that would be only an approximate position (that would not roundtrip). For example, a document position could be hidden from the text view by a collapsed region. Generic implementation common for all VS text controls. If we go from document to text control and then back successfully, then the point is not covered by a collapsed region or any other layered model artifact. Slow because at points that are actually under a collapsed region the calculations are complex sometimes. Overriding with a more specific method is recommended.

member.name: M:JetBrains.VsIntegration.DevTen.TextControl.VsTextControlDevTen.IsVsCompletorWindowActive
member.summary: Gets whether the VS completion window is currently visible over the text control.

member.name: M:JetBrains.VsIntegration.DevTen.TextControl.VsTextControlDevTen.PushOleCommandFilter(Microsoft.VisualStudio.OLE.Interop.IOleCommandTarget,Microsoft.VisualStudio.OLE.Interop.IOleCommandTarget@)
member.summary: Places an OLE command filter to the text control filters chain at the highest priority.

member.name: M:JetBrains.VsIntegration.DevTen.TextControl.VsTextControlDevTen.InitCommon
member.summary: Base init. Must be called by the inheritors after the text control is fully initialized.

summary.para: Provides access to the text control coordinate conversion, which makes it possible to represent a point on the text control or in the document in a unified way.
The rendered text gets from the document, however, it might be transformed or filtered (eg projections and collapsed regions).

That's why document line-column positions () do not always agree to the text control line-column positions (). Currently, these coordinates have different CLR types and are not so easily mixed together.

member.name: T:JetBrains.VsIntegration.DevTen.TextControl.VsTextViewSink
member.summary: Monitors vs' creation of text views and maintains the collection. This class is created by MEF, and its lifetime does not agree to the Shell lifetime.

member.name: F:JetBrains.VsIntegration.DevTen.TextControl.VsTextViewSink.VsTextViewsUnugarded
member.summary: Lists the VS text controls (views). As this collection directly reflects the VS state, even at times when the Shell is not running, it's not guarded.

member.name: M:JetBrains.VsIntegration.DevTen.TextControl.VsTextViewSink.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:JetBrains.VsIntegration.DevTen.TextControl.VsTextViewSink.Microsoft#VisualStudio#Text#Editor#IWpfTextViewCreationListener#TextViewCreated(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.Editor.IWpfTextView)
member.summary: Called when a text view having matchine roles is created over a text data model having a matching content type. Exporters must specify at least one ContentTypeAttribute and one TextViewRole, and should mark their export using the following attribute: [Export(typeof(TextViewCreationListener))], along with [ContentType()] and [TextViewRole()].
member.param: The newly created text view.
